examples: Every person has the right to express their opinions and beliefs.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but words failed him.
Women should feel free to speak their minds and express themselves.
It is important to create a supportive environment where children can express their thoughts and emotions freely.
words.defineEn: to show or make a thought, feeling, etc. known by looks, words, or actions
words.defineVi: để hiển thị hoặc làm cho một suy nghĩ, cảm giác, vv được biết đến bằng vẻ ngoài, lời nói hoặc hành động

examples: The Youtube comment sowed a seed of anger and untold frustrations which brought some questions to the forefront of her mind.
He expresses frustration.
That frustration has fueled protests.
We understand your frustration.
So I get the frustration.
words.defineEn: the feeling of being impatient, annoyed, or upset because of being unable to do or achieve what is desired
words.defineVi: cảm giác thiếu kiên nhẫn, khó chịu hoặc buồn bã vì không thể làm hoặc đạt được những gì mong muốn

examples: After becoming CEO of the company, Jack's arrogance and lack of empathy became more apparent, proving that the higher the monkey climbs, the more he shows his tail.
People with NPD can use our empathy against us.
It's empathy.
We call this empathy.
What is empathy to you?
words.defineEn: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another person
words.defineVi: khả năng hiểu và chia sẻ cảm xúc của người khác

examples: His parents gave him the encouragement he needed to succeed.
I literally would never have considered giving writing a shot without your example and encouragement.
You need some encouragement?
Here are some tips for encouragement.
- One thing of encouragement I just wanna leave you with.
words.defineEn: something that is told or given to someone in order to give them hope or provide support
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được nói hoặc trao cho ai đó để cho họ hy vọng hoặc cung cấp hỗ trợ

examples: The old man gave up the ghost.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Er, don't give up the day job!
We gave up the right to use the valley.
words.defineEn: to stop trying when faced with failures or difficulties
words.defineVi: ngừng cố gắng khi đối mặt với thất bại hoặc khó khăn

examples: I’m fed up with you two talking shop.
Farmers are angry and fed up to the back teeth of empty promises from politicians.
I'm already fed up with your lazy, selfish behavior, Jim, but if you can't be bothered to come with me to my own mother's funeral, that will be the straw that breaks the donkey's back!
He was pretty much fed up and had been kind of at the end of his rope.
I know that we're all kind of fed up with this and we want this to be over.
words.defineEn: feeling annoyed, upset, bored with something happening for a long time
words.defineVi: cảm thấy khó chịu, khó chịu, buồn chán với một điều gì đó xảy ra trong một thời gian dài

words.word: to [have] had it (up to here|) with {sb/sth}
words.phonetic: tə hæv hædɪt ʌp tə hɪɹ wɪð ɛsbiː slæʃ ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to not have the tolerance to endure more of something
words.defineVi: không có lòng khoan dung để chịu đựng nhiều hơn một cái gì đó

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to be able to tolerate, endure, or bear something
words.defineVi: để có thể chịu đựng, chịu đựng, hoặc chịu đựng một cái gì đó

examples: It was really discouraging.
It looks very discouraging at the time we're talking.
And when this happens, it could be very discouraging.
That can sometimes feel discouraging, but it’s still important to refine our methods and continue the search.
After years of seeing it fail tests and get postponed, things can feel discouraging.
words.defineEn: (of something) causing one to lose hope or confidence
words.defineVi: (của một cái gì đó) khiến một người mất hy vọng hoặc sự tự tin

examples: It's true that reality is disappointing.
She used the wrong ingredients in the recipe, resulting in a disappointing dish.
But then the wheels came off the bus in the final season, and now it's often derided as one of the most disappointing finales of all time.
After receiving the disappointing news, John's face turned dark and he had a face like thunder for the rest of the day.
And the speakers are pretty disappointing as well.
He got down from the ladder.
I must get down to booking the hotels.
It's time I got down to thinking about that essay.
The situation was so serious that after a few polite exchanges they quickly got down to brass tacks.
Drill instructor: Get down!
words.defineVi: hạ thấp tinh thần của ai đó; làm nản lòng

words.defineEn: to continue trying to succeed regardless of difficulties or challenges
words.defineVi: tiếp tục cố gắng để thành công bất kể khó khăn hay thử thách
